meanings.definition: In a vigorous and enthusiastic manner
meanings.sent1: The children sang lustily during the school play.
meanings.sent2: She cheered lustily for her favorite team at the game.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail lustily when it saw its owner.
meanings.sent4: The engine roared lustily as the car sped down the highway.
meanings.sent5: The crowd clapped lustily after the inspiring speech.

meanings.sent1: The workers hammered lustily to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: He laughed lustily at the comedian's jokes.
meanings.sent3: The baby giggled lustily while playing with its toys.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled lustily through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The dancers moved lustily to the beat of the music.
